job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Brockton, MA
pros: Fantastic nurse manager on my unit with very supportive staff. The nursing manager on my unit takes concerns into consideration and addresses them well. Scheduling is consistent but flexible. Good benefits and union membership are pluses.
cons: Because this is an inner city hospital, the patient population can be very challenging at times. Not enough CNA’s on the unit some nights, which can make busy shifts very stressful.

pros: I worked in the hospital and for the group for many years. Great people to work with, very friendly in every department. Most really do care about the patient and strive to do their best. Time off, sick time, vacations.. never an issue.
cons:
constant encouragement to put in suggestions and report issues, however things hardly ever seem to get resolved. When you go above and beyond, you're expected to go even more above next time, without reward. Its exhausting and burns staff (and management) out who really want to work well and ends up resulting in frequent turn over. 
hourly pay is average, yearly increases are only 0.3%  Benefits are expensive, PTO sick and vacation accrued together
Patient demographic can be non compliant

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician in Brockton, MA
pros: Co-workers and hospital staff are nice and easy to work with. The management team is fantastic to work for. I love this job. I learn something new everyday, I feel trusted and appreciated, and the pay starting out was really good!
cons: Although the analyzers in the lab are newer and work fairly well with little issue, the rest of the lab is a little bit behind the times and could use some updating to work mor efficiently. Not really that big of a deal of course.

job_title: Medical Office Coordinator in Brockton, MA
pros: If you want a job where no one communicates with anyone, no matter who was responsible for completing a task it still ends up being your fault and where you feel grossly undervalued, this would be a good place to work.  Management not only doesn't communicate, but flat out lies when questioned.
cons: Lack of appreciation, no clear responsibility, management scapegoats and lies to employees, lack of parking, management refuses to pay for overtime (even if you were required to work it), lack of support by co-workers, potential of being injured by combative patients, lack of job security and no warning that job will be ending.

review_title: Hospital that CARES about its patients and employees.
pros: Salary and benefits are excellent compared to surrounding Hospitals and Health Centers
cons: Trying to go outside of network for certain healthcare issues results in higher costs for employee in some situations and circumstances.

cons: The things I don't like about this job are some of the coworkers are very judgmental. Also finding someone to cover your shift is hard.
